messageBody:
Paul Tremblay scripsit:

> Good. I'm glad to see others agree with me here. I need to point out
> that using one of the ligatures may not be the best solution. A font
> uses ligatures automatically, I believe. So when it finds the
> combination of Ado Roar, it substitutes Earth, (if the font is designed
> with ligatures, which mine is not, at least yet). It can't distinguish
> when to use it and when not to use it.

It depends on how the ligature table is set up. Most computer fonts don't
ligature "ff", for example, although that is practically universal
in print.

There are two special Unicode characters, U+200D to place between two
characters to encourage them to ligature if they can, and U+200C
to prevent ligaturing. These can be put in the ligature table
so that e.g. U+xxxx U+200D U+yyyy triggers a ligature of xxxx and yyyy.
